metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000255 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
On Linux running on PowerPC hardware (Power8 or later) a user process cancraft a signal frame and then do a sigreturn so that the kernel will takean exception (interrupt), and use the r1 value *from the signal frame* asthe kernel stack pointer. As part of the exception entry the content of thesignal frame is written to the kernel stack, allowing an attacker tooverwrite arbitrary locations with arbitrary values. The exception handlingdoes produce an oops, and a panic if panic_on_oops=1, but only after kernelmemory has been over written. This flaw was introduced in commit:"5d176f751ee3 (powerpc: tm: Enable transactional memory (TM) lazily foruserspace)" which was merged upstream into v4.9-rc1. Please note thatkernels built with CONFIG_PPC_TRANSACTIONAL_MEM=n are not vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000255` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.10.0-37-generic - 4.10.0-37.41~16.04.1
linux-image-4.10.0-37-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-37.41~16.04.1
linux-image-4.10.0-37-lowlatency - 4.10.0-37.41~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-37-generic - 4.10.0-37.41~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-37.41~16.04.1').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
